play_button.en:
Press here to start and stop playback.

Alternatively, on desktop, you can just press SPACE!

title_commands.en:
Click on the title here to sample brand new data from the remote model, useful if you're feeling stuck at some point!

The arrows are for classic undo/redo functionality (and keyboard shortcuts are supported too).

note_box.en:
Touch these dotted boxes to trigger a regeneration of the underlying portion of the score.
You can also scroll on these boxes to vary the granularity.
note_box.de: Tippen Sie auf die gestrichelten Kästen des Notenblattes, um die darunter liegenden Teile der Partitur neu generieren zu lassen.

fermata_box.de: Tippen Sie auf die gestrichelten Kästchen, um eine Fermata zu setzen. Damit kann die Struktur des Chorales kontrolliert werden.
fermata_box.en: Touch the dotted boxes to position an intermediate fermata. On your following regeneration operations, these will guide the model by requesting it to add an intermediate conclusion here, allowing you to structure your generations.

playback.en:
Click here to start and stop playback.

Alternatively, on desktop, you can just press SPACE or even use your keyboard as a piano!

midi_in.en: If on a compatible browser, use this pane to configure MIDI Input for low latency playback using a MIDI keyboard or in conjunction with a DAW.

spectrogram.en:
This spectrogram image represents the current sound in a time-frequency fashion.
Click and drag on the cells of this grid to regenerate the underlying zones in the spectrogram.

constraints.en:
Here you can define the constraints used when painting over the spectrogram.

Think of these as the color palette in which you dip your brushes!

edit_tools.en:
Selects the edit tool for regeneration. There are currently three different modes:
  • inpaint: the default mode, regenerate zones using both context and constraints,
  • randomize: regenerate at random without using either context or constraints,
  • erase: manually silence portions of the sound.
Toggle the Refine button to edit fine-grain details, keeping the general idea structure of the sound (more-or-less) fixed.

download.en: Click here at any point to store the current sound locally on your machine.

drag-n-drop.en:
...oh, and you can also drag and drop an audio file from your computer anywhere onto the app to import it and transform it thereafter!

Imported sounds must weigh at most 2MB if using the hosted API and will automatically be cropped to 1min.

fade-in.en:
Declick adds a slight fade-in to the audio playback. This can reduce ear-fatigue when working with sounds containing strong attacks.

Note that the fade-in is not applied when storing sounds via the download button!
